page.title: 20THE DOMESDAY PROJECT
page.content: We went around the parish to get information for the Domesday Project. On our way up Jubilee Hill we saw some Saxon mounds which were part of a field system. Our one industrial site around here is the firework factory. On the side of the road we saw a little pill box that was used in the war. These are rather rare now and there are not many left. Around one field were some little Nissen huts which are semi-circular. We also saw some cows in the field and most of them were Fresians or Herefordshires. In the distance were some silos for storing grain. On the Highpost Hotel's sign post there was a picture of a hanging gibbet, so it was most probable that they used to hang criminals at the crossroads.
